name: HD 142415
scenarioDescription:
The HD 142415 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 142415 is a star with 1.07 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.04 times its radius. It is located 116.01 light years away from the solar system.

HD 142415 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 142415 system


HD 142415 b

HD 142415 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 142415 b is 531.06 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 142415 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 142415, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by La Silla Observatory.
